xcsf
Class XCSFUtils.GnuPlotConsole

java.lang.Object
  xcsf.XCSFUtils.GnuPlotConsole
Enclosing class:
XCSFUtils
public static class XCSFUtils.GnuPlotConsole
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to communicate with a GnuPlot instance. See http://www.gnuplot.info/ for details about GnuPlot.

Support for

  • Windows (executable: C:/Programme/gnuplot/bin/pgnuplot.exe)
  • Linux (executable: gnuplot)

Example Code: 

 GnuPlotConsole gnuplot = new GnuPlotConsole();
 gnuplot.writeln("set xrange[0:1];set yrange[0:1]");
 gnuplot.writeln("set isosamples 20,20");
 gnuplot.writeln("set contour; set surface");
 gnuplot.writeln("set title '2D Sine Function'");
 gnuplot.writeln("splot sin(4 * pi * (x+y)) title 'sinus(4 PI (x+y))'");

Author:
Patrick O. Stalph

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

XCSFUtils.GnuPlotConsole

public XCSFUtils.GnuPlotConsole()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
Default constructor executes GnuPlot and establishes the communication channel via a PrintStream.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the system fails to execute gnuplot.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if gnuplot is not installed.
Method Detail

writeln

public void writeln(java.lang.String command)
Sends the given command to GnuPlot. Multiple commands can be seperated with a semicolon.

Parameters:
command - the command.
